page.title: 05TAKELEY, THE INDUSTRY
page.content: The technological age has not passed Takeley by. The largest single employer in the village is Neotronics, manufacturers of environmental protection instrumentation and energy conservation equipment. The firm, established in 1973, now employs 160 people and intends to expand in 1985. Another employer is Barkers who manufacture large oil tanks. This firm, situated in the centre of the village, will soon move away to make room for further housing development. Other employers are small, having only a few employees. These include crash repair specialists, caravan sales and service, and gravel extraction which has started at Little Canfield. However, agriculture is the largest industry in the area.
